customer_name: Wizard of Paws Wildlife Education Inc
site_name: Wizard of Paws Wildlife Education Inc

citations.narrative:
Accumulations of hair and dust remain in the fox room. Also, hair, excreta, and urine mineralization is built up on the fox
enclosure litter trays. Accumulations of hair, urine, excreta, and other debris may harbor disease hazards, posing a threat
to animal health. Enclosures, litter trays, and housing facilities shall be cleaned as often as necessary to minimize
disease hazards and reduce odors.
Remains Uncorrected

An excessive amount of clutter and stored items remain in the animal housing areas. Stored items impinge space such
that there is minimal clearance to work with and access the animals, clean enclosures and housing rooms, as well as
provide repair to and maintain enclosures. Optimal animal welfare is hindered in such cramped quarters. Premises shall
be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate prescribed husbandry practices.
Remains Uncorrected
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the President and Vice President.
End Section

narrative:

Sanitation. 
Accumulations of hair and dust remain in the fox room.  Also, hair, excreta, and urine mineralization is built up on the fox 
enclosure litter trays.  Accumulations of hair, urine, excreta, and other debris may harbor disease hazards, posing a threat

disease hazards and reduce odors.

3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
An excessive amount of clutter and stored items remain in the animal housing areas.  Stored items impinge space such 
that there is minimal clearance to work with and access the animals, clean enclosures and housing rooms, as well as 
provide repair to and maintain enclosures.  Optimal animal welfare is hindered in such cramped quarters.  Premises shall 
be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate prescribed husbandry practices. 
Remains Uncorrected 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the President and Vice President.

End Section

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
